text: Job’s Final Defense Continued
“But now \add those\add* younger than I, as far as days, laugh at me,
whose fathers I rejected for setting with the dogs of my sheep and goats.
Moreover, ⸤what use to me is the strength of their hands⸥?\f + \fr 30:2 \ft Literally “the strength of their hands what \fq is \ft for me” \f*
With them, vigor is destroyed.
Through want and through barren hunger
they are gnawing \add in the\add* dry region \add in the\add* darkness of desolation and waste.
They are picking salt herbs, the leaves of bushes,
and \add the\add* roots of broom trees to warm themselves.
They were driven out from fellow people;
they shout at them as \add at\add* a\f + \fr 30:5 \ft Hebrew “the” \f* thief,
⸤so that they dwell⸥\f + \fr 30:6 \ft Literally “to dwell” \f*
\add in\add* holes of \add the\add* ground and \add in the\add* rocks.
They bray among \add the\add* bushes;
they are gathered under \add the\add* nettles.
⸤A senseless crowd⸥,\f + \fr 30:8 \ft Literally “sons of good-for-nothing” \f* yes, ⸤a disreputable brood⸥,\f + \fr 30:8 \ft Literally “sons of no name” \f*
they were cast out from the land.
“But now I am their mocking song,
and I have become a byword for them.
They abhor me; they keep aloof from me,
and they do not withhold spit from my face
because he has loosened his bowstring and humbled me,
and they have thrown off restraint ⸤in my presence⸥.\f + \fr 30:11 \ft Literally “from my face” \f*
On \add the\add* right hand the brood rises\f + \fr 30:12 \ft Hebrew “rise” \f* up;
⸤they put me to flight⸥,\f + \fr 30:12 \ft Literally “my feet they send away” \f*
and they build up their ⸤siege ramps⸥\f + \fr 30:12 \ft Literally “the ways/paths of their disaster” \f* against me.
They destroy my path;
they promote my destruction;
they have no helper.
As \add through\add* a wide breach they come;
amid a crash they rush on.
Terrors are turned upon me;
my honor is pursued as \add by\add* the wind,
and my hope of deliverance passed by like a cloud.
“And now my life is poured out onto me;
days of misery have taken hold of me.
⸤At night I am in great pain⸥;\f + \fr 30:17 \ft Literally “night my bones he pierces upon me,” or “night pierces my bones upon me” \f*
my pains do not take a rest.
He seizes my clothing with ⸤great power⸥;\f + \fr 30:18 \ft Literally “much of strength” \f*
he grasps me by my tunic’s collar.
He has cast me into the dirt,
and I have become like dust\f + \fr 30:19 \ft Hebrew “the dust” \f* and ashes.
I cry to you for help, but\f + \fr 30:20 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* you do not answer me;
I stand, and you \add merely\add* look at me.
You have turned cruel to me;
you persecute me with your hand’s might.
You lift me up to \add the\add* wind—you make me ride \add it\add*,
and you toss me about \add in\add* the storm.
Indeed, I know \add that\add* you will bring me to death
and \add to the\add* house of assembly for all \add the\add* living.
“Surely someone must not send a hand against \add the\add* needy
when, in his misfortune, \add there is\add* a cry of help for them.
Have I not wept for ⸤the unfortunate⸥,\f + \fr 30:25 \ft Literally “hard of day” \f*
\add and\add* grieved myself over the poor?
Indeed, I hoped for good, but evil came,
and I waited for light, but darkness came.
My bowels are in turmoil, and they are not still;
days of misery come to confront me.
I go \add about\add* in mourning garb, \add but\add* not in sunlight;
I stand up in the assembly, \add and\add* I cry for help.
I am a companion for \add the\add* jackals
and a companion for ⸤ostriches⸥.\f + \fr 30:29 \ft Literally “daughters of ostrich” \f*
My skin turns black on me,
and my bones burn with heat.
So\f + \fr 30:31 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* my lyre came to be \add used\add* for mourning,
and my flute \add for the\add* voice of \add those who\add* weep.
